a.span: Go to Lewis and Clark Conference...

font.b: Ponca School District classes will continue to be taught remotely until May 22nd!

h3.a: Ponca and Dixon County Food Pantries

div.p:
Ponca Public School District was notified that Michael Foods, INC., of Wakefield, NE, has made donations of egg products to the food pantries in Ponca. Families may contact the following individuals to make arrangements to pick up these products:
Dixon County Food Pantry
Contact Person: Ken Johnson @ United Methodist Church, 223 W. 2nd . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Ponca and Dixon County Food Pantries

h3.a: From the desk of Jody Phillips

div.p: Good evening Ponca parents, staff, and students. We have completed the second week of remote learning during our school closure. Our students have done an exceptional job of holding themselves accountable and completing their classroom work and assignments. We, again, thank our parents for supporting their children and helping to ensure all our students are ready for next school year. . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about From the desk of Jody Phillips

h3.a: Ponca Public School District Plan for Remote Learning

div.p:
Supporting Learning in the Cloud
Ponca Public School is committed to building a solid educational foundation for all individuals by providing a quality learning environment and promoting standards of excellence.
In the wake of the coronavirus the administration, teachers and staff are designing systems that provide meaningful engagement in the learning process through virtual means that enable Ponca Public Schools to . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Ponca Public School District Plan for Remote Learning

div.p: Attention All Ponca Parents (and Teachers and Staff too!): We are looking for some help with yearbook pictures during this whole crazy experience! We really want to find a way to have some fun and remember this important moment in history in our 2020 yearbook. We'd like you to capture pictures of your students in their alternate "classroom" settings (practicing safe social distancing as well) during this continuity of . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Ponca Yearbook Needs Pictures

h3.a: Tips for Parents During COVID-19 Pandemic

div.h4: Article from the Nebraska School Counselor Association
div.p: Click to read Tips for Parents During COVID-19 Pandemic

a.aria-label: Read more about Tips for Parents During COVID-19 Pandemic

div.p:
NSEA has undertaken a project to broadcast lessons to students called TeacherTV. Through this project daily lessons are being broadcast over News Channel Nebraska. There are two hours of lessons for Elementary students each morning and two hours of lessons for Secondary students in the afternoon.
WATCH TODAY as 2020 Nebraska School . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Teacher TV

div.p: It is necessary to complete all of the enrollment forms and submit the registration fee in order to be on the official roster.

a.aria-label: Read more about Pre-School Open House

div.em: Current conditions as of 19 Apr 22:52 pm CDT

div.span: A chance of showers, mainly between midnight and 4am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 40. Calm wind becoming southwest around 5 mph after midnight. Chance of precipitation is 40%.
Mostly sunny, with a high near 67. Breezy, with a southwest wind 5 to 10 mph becoming west northwest 15 to 25 mph in the afternoon. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph.
Mostly cloudy, then gradually becoming clear, with a low around 34. Breezy, with a north northwest wind 15 to 20 mph decreasing to 5 to 10 mph after midnight. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph.

form.p: Sign up for the News Update.

p.a: This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

span.span: The Ponca Public School District does not discriminate on the basis of sex, disability, race, color, religion, veteran status, national or ethnic origin, age, marital status, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical condition, or other protected status in its programs and activities and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following persons have been designated to handle inquiries regarding the non-discrimination policies:
Students: Mr. Jody Phillips, Superintendent of Schools, PO Box 568, Ponca, NE 68770 (402) 755-5700 (jodyphillips@poncaschool.org).
Employees and Others: Mr. Jody Phillips, Superintendent of Schools, PO Box 568, Ponca, NE 68770 (402) 755-5700 (jodyphillips@poncaschool.org).

Complaints or concerns involving discrimination or needs for accommodation or access should be addressed to the appropriate Coordinator. For further information about anti-discrimination laws and regulations, or to file a complaint of discrimination with the Office for Civil Rights in the U.S. Department of Education (OCR), please contact OCR at One Petticoat Lane, 1010 Walnut Street, 3rd Floor, Suite 320, Kansas City, Missouri 64106, (816) 268-0550 (voice), Fax (816) 268-0599, (800) 877-8339 (telecommunications device for the deaf), or ocr.kansascity@ed.gov.
